p: High radiation/UV Stress. Plants require appropriate intensity of light for photosynthesis, which in turn influences the quality and accumulation of SMs. Therefore, the literature indicates the conspicuous effect of photoperiod and light intensity on the biosynthesis and storage of SMs [ 19]. Lettuce, spinach, brassica, wheat, strawberry, tomato among the horticultural crops and apple and grapevine showed increases in polyphenols under UV or light stress [ 8, 22, 23].
